text:
Question 118) In fish farming, artemia (crustacean) larvae is usually used to feed fish larvae. Artemia eggs are placed in bottles with salt water and, under optimal conditions of temperature, light and oxygen, they outlined, releasing their larvae, also known as cassa. To collect the nauplios, a fluorescent white lamp is placed in the mouth of the bottle and they begin to climb toward the neck.
This behavior of artemias is called
A) Positive geotropism.
B) Positive phototropism.
C) negative hydrotropism.
D) negative thermotropism.
E) negative chemotropism.
